author: .paulharris
content:
Now that we've got a name for EIP4844, i'm pretty much ready to merge that branch back into master.
Before I do that, wondering if we take a beacon-apis release that should be Capella complete, prior to starting to add in Deneb Apis. Thoughts?

author: sproul
content: A release for Capella sounds good

author: .paulharris
content: I'll see if there's anything in PR format we need to merge before that can happen if i get a sec ðŸ™‚

author: .paulharris
content:
all - for POST `bls_to_execution_changes`, deposit-cli is going to allow generating the messages...
It does have a metadata field in each generated object, (https://github.com/ethereum/staking-deposit-cli/issues/312) which isn't explicitly listed in the beacon-apis.
I'm wondering if any clients are strictly parsing these posts and will break. One option is to put a beacon-api PR up to explicitly list these fields as optional, but if all clients will just ignore that metadata, it's not really needed...

author: jgm
content: Not sure we want to be changing specs to meet the vagaries of a particular to. The data is not required by the beacon nodes, so really shouldn't be listed in the API.

author: .paulharris
content: That's my assumption, as long as people are tolerant of undefined data which i recall has been problematic in the past

author: jgm
content: Yep, but if it is a problem we should change the tool rather than the spec.

author: .paulharris
content: Fair call. I'm happy with that as a running theory.
